title: Lesson 6
paragraph: Health is important for daily life; caring for the body prevents illness and speeds recovery. Regular exercise, a balanced diet, and timely medical advice help people stay well. Hospitals, nurses and doctors support patients when they need treatment.

words.meaning: a continuous, dull pain
words.example: I have an ache in my lower back.

words.meaning: the joint connecting foot and leg
words.example: She twisted her ankle while running.

words.meaning: the red fluid that circulates in the body
words.example: They tested his blood for infections.

words.meaning: hard tissue forming the skeleton
words.example: He broke a bone in his arm.

words.meaning: the organ that controls thought and body functions
words.example: The brain processes information quickly.

words.meaning: to take air into and out of the lungs
words.example: Remember to breathe slowly during the exercise.

words.meaning: the upper front part of the body containing the heart and lungs
words.example: He felt tightness in his chest.

words.meaning: to make a disease or condition go away
words.example: Doctors hope to find a cure for the disease.

words.meaning: a doctor who treats teeth
words.example: I visited the dentist for a check-up.

words.meaning: the food a person eats regularly
words.example: She changed her diet to include more vegetables.

words.meaning: a disorder that affects health
words.example: They studied how to prevent the disease.

words.meaning: physical activity to keep the body fit
words.example: Daily exercise improves stamina.

words.meaning: an abnormally high body temperature
words.example: He stayed home because of a fever.

words.meaning: a state of poor health

words.meaning: the joint between the thigh and lower leg

words.meaning: a substance used to treat illnesses
words.example: Take the medicine twice a day.

words.meaning: tissue that produces movement in the body

words.meaning: a healthcare professional who cares for patients

words.meaning: a person receiving medical care
words.example: The patient recovered after treatment.
